title: 109_hr3672
content: The Act titled "TANF Emergency Response and Recovery Act of 2005" allows for advance payment of TANF block grants for the first quarter of fiscal year 2006. The TANF Emergency Response and Recovery Act of 2005 authorizes advance payment of TANF block grants for the first quarter of fiscal year 2006, extending activities through December 31, 2005, with necessary appropriations from the Treasury. The TANF Emergency Response and Recovery Act of 2005 extends activities through December 31, 2005, with various conforming amendments and an extension of the National Random Sample Study of Child Welfare and Child Welfare Waiver Authority. Activities authorized by sections 429A and 1130(a) of the Social Security Act will continue through December 31, 2005, with necessary appropriations from the Treasury for grants and payments. This extends the Child Welfare Waiver Authority and related activities through the first quarter of fiscal year 2006 at the same level as the first quarter of fiscal year 2005. Reimbursement of states for TANF benefits provided to assist families affected by Hurricane Katrina. Eligibility for Payments From the Contingency Fund for needy States affected by Hurricane Katrina, providing short-term, nonrecurring cash benefits to families who have relocated due to the hurricane. The text discusses the limitation on funding for needy States under the Social Security Act, specifying that the total amount paid to a State shall not exceed the cash benefits provided to families. No State match is required for payments made under this section. SEC. 4. Availability of additional TANF funds for hurricane-damaged states: Louisiana, Mississippi, and Alabama eligible for loans under the Social Security Act until the end of fiscal year 2006. Loans made to these states cannot exceed 20% of the State family assistance grant for fiscal year 2006. Forgiveness of loans and penalties waived for failure to repay or make interest payments on loans. States affected by Hurricane Katrina can use TANF funds for benefits and services without time limits. Temporary TANF benefits for hurricane-affected families won't trigger work requirements or time limits. Penalties for TANF non-compliance waived in hurricane-damaged states. SEC. 7. Waiver of TANF penalties in hurricane-damaged states: The Secretary of Health and Human Services will not penalize Louisiana, Mississippi, or Alabama for non-compliance with certain provisions of the Social Security Act due to Hurricane Katrina. SEC. 8. Emergency designation: All amounts in this Act are designated as emergency requirements.
